intro: Heptapleurum triste, commonly known as the sad heptapleurum, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and compact growth habit. The plant typically features small, leathery leaves that are arranged in a whorled pattern around the stems. It produces clusters of small, white or pale pink flowers during the spring and summer months. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in shaded gardens, though it is not widely distributed in horticulture.
